intro: Acer capillipes, commonly known as the slender maple, is a deciduous tree native to China. It is characterized by its finely toothed, ovate leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by samaras with winged seeds. It typically grows to a height of 10–15 meters and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and parks.
